title: Trump's Name on Stimulus Checks
summary: Treasury added 'President Donald J. Trump' to memo line of ~70 million paper stimulus checks - first time in history a president's name appeared on IRS payment. IRS officials said change would 'probably lead to a delay.' Required time-consuming reprogramming. IRS sought legal advice about potential Hatch Act violations. Trump also sent follow-up letters with his signature.
keyFacts: Treasury added 'President Donald J. Trump' to memo line of ~70 million paper stimulus checks
First time in history a president's name appeared on IRS payment
Treasury Secretary Mnuchin instructed IRS to add Trump's name
IRS officials said change would 'probably lead to a delay' in first batch of paper checks
Required time-consuming reprogramming of computer systems and check redesign
IRS sought legal advice about potential Hatch Act violations
Lawyers concluded 'no clear legal prohibition' but concerns remained about precedent
Trump also sent follow-up letters with his signature to stimulus recipients
